comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: In 1898 the U.S. Post Office Department issued a set of nine commemorative postage stamps to mark the 1898 Trans-Mississippi Exposition in Omaha. The finely engraved stamps of the Trans-Mississippi Issue, or "Trans-Miss" or simply the "Omahas" for short, depict various scenes of the West and are today highly prized by collectors.                                                                              Western Cattle in Storm                    United States 1-dollar stamp of 1898 Trans-Mississippi issue.                  Known as the "Black Bull", this is often considered the finest                  design ever seen on a US stamp. (Scott 292)
